lines.text: Why don't you dig in with me? I got a room. I only owe two weeks rent.
Say, do I look like that?
It's no proposition. You're out in the rainstorm and you haven't got an umbrella.
Shut that door. I am extremely nervous!
I have seen enough. I am presenting you with a belly full of lead.

[Opening scene. Extreme close up of a Nicaraguan woman in a bar slowly shaking her backside to-and-fro]
I didn't think the Marines would keep their promise when they said they'd show me the world. There's a little wiggle that has a meaning all its own. Hey Bill, how's your rhumba?
[Bill starts to unzip his pants]
Now, don't get so personal.
Oh, rhumba's a dance! You stupid?
Well, I still say its a lovely day.
What are you selling, weather reports? Don't waste your time, I'm broke.
You would be.
Well, I guess the Depression's hit every business.
Oh, you got me wrong, buddy. I'm a stenographer without a typewriter to pound or piece of gum to chew or a place to put it.
Park the body, honey. Squat.
Thank you, seh.
Mississippi?
No seh, Sugarville, Alabama, had me. But, New York's got me.
Okay, Alabama!
I've been expecting you! I knew you were too good to be true.
I just wanted to see how you were getting on.
Yeah, I've heard that one before. And I don't need to be tucked in, neither!
Where you going?
YWCA!
Oh, now wait a minute, you got me wrong! Honest, it's not going to happen again. Not while I'm sober.
Well, I'll take a chance. Back to your cell, monk.
Pleasant dreams, sweetheart. No talking in your sleep, now.
I wouldn't do this
[share a bed]
for anybody but you, Bill.
Not even Greta Garbo?
Oh, well, but she's out of town.
Keep your pants on, brother! I was flying airplanes when you thought a joy stick was a lollypop.
Well, the worst is over, lady. The chutes open.
But, he's fallin' so fast!
Well, he's got to come down.
Look at those stars. Ah, it's a swell night, isn't it?
Awfully swell. Did you ever study astronomy?
No. Just anatomy.
I mean the study of heavenly bodies.
Well.
Say, I wonder if those stars were wise to use two days ago, heh?
Maybe, they wink a lot.
It's like a cock-eyed dream.
Cock-eyed is right.
I hope it stays nice and cock-eyed.
I knew a dame would spoil things, just when you landed a good job.
Can you make a fire, Keller?
Yessum.
Then, come up. Make me a fire.
She's coming across with some cash, now. But, I got to go up and build a fire.
What are you, a visiting fireman?
A fire? That dame looks plenty hot to me!
It won't be long. You just stay here and pot like this until I come back.
Okay, but, that fire racket burns me up.
You act as if you're afraid of me.
Me? No, there's not a woman on earth that I can't lick.
He's been up there an hour, Toodles. It wouldn't take that long to build a fire with a pocket lighter.
Maybe he's rubbin' two dried sticks together.
Understand, you're not just an ordinary chauffeur. I engage you because I like you and you seem quite competent. I think you'll enjoy the position.
I suppose there'll be considerable night work.
Oh, some. Naturally, you'll receive compensation for overtime.
I'm making an exception in your case. All of my chauffeurs have been Frenchmen. I think, as a rule, they are, they're more versatile.
Well, did you get any breaks today, kid?
No, I guess people have stopped writing letters. I've got a sneakin' idea there's an oversupply of typewriter massagers.
Say listen, when are you, when are you going to stop saying no to me?
Oh, I knew you were going to spoil things.
No, no, no, no. I mean, I mean we can... get married.
Married? But, you don't know anything about me. You don't even know how old I am.
Well, that's alright. You look over 18.
Good morning, Mr. Weber. I'm Miss Brent.
Oh, yes. Won't you come a little closer, please. Well, what, eh, what experience have you had?
Three years, Mr. Weber. Shorthand. Typing. In fact, I think I can make myself quite handy around the office.
Three years? Why, you don't look 17.
I can look older, if you want me to.
Never mind where I came from; but, you better start talking and talk fast, big eyes.
This ain't a social call and we ain't stayin' that long.
No, well, I'm very sorry.
Yes, I sort of thought you'd be. Now get this, we're through flying your whoopie water from Canada.
How many times do I have to tell you, I'm sorry? Do I have to get down on my knees?
You're no Mammy singer! The less you say, the better I'll like it.
But, you didn't have to move out on us!

I don't want any charity from you or from anybody! I had to have a job. And when I got the chance with Weber, I had to make the grade; however, I could. Now, as for what you overheard in there, made just about as much as a politician's promise.
Where'd you get the elegant burlap?
Where'd you get the tux?
Mr. Weber bought it for me.
Mr. Weber took me buy buy too. Do you like it?
What there is of it.
If these mugs get gay, remember they pack their rods here.
[Pats back pant's pocket]
I'm gettin' outta here before the law blows in.
So, you are turning yellow, heh, Steve?
Now, listen, if it was only liquor, I wouldn't care. But, when you start running...
Hold on a minute! You mean to tell me we've been flying something else? I mean, dope?
Now, Bill, my boy, don't get excited.
Nah, it's only 10 years in the Federal Pen.
Are these bags, they're full of that junk?
